quicksort

Class TextbookQuicksort

  • java.lang.Object
    • quicksort.TextbookQuicksort

  • public class TextbookQuicksort
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Hunter R. Caskey ClosestPairs - This java class provides implementation for finding the closest pair of Point in a graph. Provided are there solutions to this problem - one brute force method that runs in O(n^2) time, an efficient solution that runs in O(nlog(n)) time, and an algorithm that finds the general case of m pairs of closest points which utilizes the efficient solution to the case of a single pair of points.

      • quicksort_textbook

        public static void quicksort_textbook(int[] inputArray,
                                      int lowerIndex,
                                      int upperIndex)
        Performs a quicksort on an array by choosing the upper bound as an arbitrary pivot.
        Parameters:
        inputArray - The array to be sorted.
        lowerIndex - The index specifying the lower bound of the range of the inputArray to partition.
        upperIndex - The index specifying the upper bound of the range of the inputArray to partition.

      • partition_textbook

        public static int partition_textbook(int[] inputArray,
                                     int lowerIndex,
                                     int upperIndex)
        Partitions a subarray of inputArray such that all elements within the lower half of the subarray are less than or equal to the elements within the upper half of the subarray. Arbitrarily choose the value at the upperIndex as a pivot value.
        Parameters:
        inputArray - The array for which a range will be partitioned.
        lowerIndex - The lower range bound of the subarray to partition.
        upperIndex - The upper range bound of the subarray to partition.
        Returns:
        The index of the last element to be swapped from the partition operation.

      • quicksort_median_of_three

        public static void quicksort_median_of_three(int[] inputArray,
                                             int lowerIndex,
                                             int upperIndex)
        Performs a quicksort on an array by choosing the median of the upper, middle, and lower indices as a pivot.
        Parameters:
        inputArray - The array to be sorted.
        lowerIndex - The index specifying the lower bound of the range of the inputArray to partition.
        upperIndex - The index specifying the upper bound of the range of the inputArray to partition.

      • partition_median_of_three

        public static int partition_median_of_three(int[] inputArray,
                                            int lowerIndex,
                                            int upperIndex)
        Partitions a subarray of inputArray such that all elements within the lower half of the subarray are less than or equal to the elements within the upper half of the subarray. Use the median of lower, middle, and upper indices of the range to partition as the pivot point.
        Parameters:
        inputArray - The array for which a range will be partitioned.
        lowerIndex - The lower range bound of the subarray to partition.
        upperIndex - The upper range bound of the subarray to partition.
        Returns:
        The index of the last element to be swapped from the partition operation.

      • median_of_three

        public static int median_of_three(int[] inputArray,
                                  int lowerIndex,
                                  int upperIndex)
        Arranges the supplied lowerIndex, upperIndex, and middle index between the two in increasing order and returns the median of the three elements (the middle index after all swaps have been made).
        Parameters:
        inputArray - The array to be operated upon.
        lowerIndex - The lower index that will be used to calculate the median of three.
        upperIndex - The upper index that will be used to calculate the median of three.
        Returns:
        The median of three index, this is the de facto middle element of the range provided after swaps have occurred.

                            int indexA,

        Swaps two elements in a given array.
        Parameters:
        inputArray - The array to perform the swap in.
        indexA - One of the elements that are being swapped.
        indexB - The other element being swapped.

      • outputTestResults

        public static void outputTestResults(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> logger,
                                     java.lang.String fileName)
        Outputs the given log statements to the command line if the number of lines to print is less than 30, otherwise writes the lines to the specified file.
        Parameters:
        logger - ArrayList containing all of the log statements to output.
        fileName - The name of the file that logs should be written to, null value indicates that the output should be printed to the console.
